## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been using VRSCTEST for a while now, but I haven't updated it in a while. What should I do if I have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to the latest release?

**AI Assistant:**
If you've been using an older version of VRSCTEST, it's essential to take a few steps before running the new update. You need to delete specific directories depending on your operating system. For Linux, delete `~/.komodo/vrsctest`; for MacOS, delete `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`; and for Windows, delete `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`. This will ensure a smooth transition to the latest version. Have you updated VRSCTEST successfully?

What should I do if I have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to the latest release?

If you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to the latest release, you need to delete specific directories before running the new update. The directories to delete vary depending on your operating system: for Linux, delete `~/.komodo/vrsctest`; for MacOS, delete `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`; and for Windows, delete `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`.

## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
